oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nucleon density distribution in C-9
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RAFI, S
BHAGWAT, A
HAIDER, W
GAMBHIR, YK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: PROTON ELASTIC-SCATTERING
MONTE-CARLO CALCULATIONS
MATTER DISTRIBUTION
NEUTRON
DEPENDENCE
ISOTOPES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Recently the measured proton-(9)Celastic angular distribution at 300 MeV/nucleon had been analyzed within the Brueckner-Hartree-Fock framework. The Argonne v-18 internucleon potential was used to generate the reaction matrices which were then folded over C-9 density distributions obtained by using the relativistic mean-field model. The calculations yield a satisfactory agreement with the experimental data.
